title: Lesson 19
paragraph: Nature, animals and weather describe the world around us. Knowing words for animals, plants, climate and natural events helps us talk about the environment, seasons and conservation efforts to protect wildlife and habitats.

words.meaning: the invisible mixture of gases we breathe
words.example: Fresh air is good for health.

words.meaning: a living creature that is not a plant
words.example: Many animals live in the forest.

words.meaning: a large mammal with thick fur
words.example: We saw a bear at the wildlife park.

words.meaning: a warm-blooded animal with feathers and wings
words.example: A colourful bird sat on the branch.

words.meaning: an insect with large colourful wings
words.example: The garden was full of butterflies.

words.meaning: a small domesticated carnivorous mammal kept as a pet
words.example: The cat slept on the windowsill.

words.meaning: large farm animals kept for meat or milk, such as cows
words.example: The farm has many cattle.

words.meaning: the usual weather patterns in a region
words.example: Climate affects what crops can grow.

words.meaning: a female bovine often kept for milk
words.example: The cow grazed in the field.

words.meaning: plants grown for food or profit
words.example: This year's crop was bountiful.

words.meaning: a wild ruminant mammal with antlers
words.example: A deer crossed the road at dawn.

words.meaning: a domesticated animal kept as a pet and companion
words.example: The dog chased a ball in the park.

words.meaning: an intelligent marine mammal known for swimming and jumping
words.example: We watched dolphins play near the boat.

words.meaning: a very large mammal with a trunk and tusks
words.example: The elephant used its trunk to drink water.

words.meaning: the natural world in which living things exist
words.example: Protecting the environment is essential.

words.meaning: land used for growing crops or keeping animals
words.example: They visited a dairy farm.

words.meaning: a person who works on a farm
words.example: The farmer harvested wheat in autumn.

words.meaning: an open area of land used for farming or recreation
words.example: Children played football in the field.

words.meaning: a cold-blooded aquatic animal that lives in water
words.example: We saw many fish while snorkeling.

words.meaning: the coloured part of a plant used for reproduction
words.example: She picked a bright flower from the garden.

words.meaning: low-lying clouds that reduce visibility
words.example: The morning fog delayed the flight.

words.meaning: a large area covered with trees
words.example: The forest is home to many species.

words.meaning: a small ruminant animal often kept for milk or meat
words.example: The goat climbed the rocky hill.

words.meaning: green plants that cover fields and lawns
words.example: The grass was wet with dew.

words.meaning: high temperature or warmth
words.example: The heat was intense at midday.

words.meaning: a large domesticated animal used for riding and work
words.example: She rode the horse along the trail.

words.meaning: a small animal with six legs and often wings
words.example: Many insects visit the flowers.

words.meaning: a large wild cat known as the 'king of the jungle'
words.example: The lion roared loudly at the zoo.

words.meaning: the natural satellite that orbits the Earth
words.example: The full moon lit the night sky.

words.meaning: existing in or caused by nature; not made by humans
words.example: Natural habitats are important for wildlife.

words.meaning: the physical world and its phenomena
words.example: We spent the weekend enjoying nature.

words.meaning: an animal kept for companionship
words.example: They adopted a pet rabbit.

words.meaning: a large body that orbits a star
words.example: Earth is the third planet from the sun.

words.meaning: a living organism that grows in the soil and makes food through photosynthesis
words.example: Water the plant every few days.

words.meaning: the introduction of harmful substances into the environment
words.example: Pollution affects air and water quality.

words.meaning: a small mammal with long ears and a short tail
words.example: A rabbit hopped across the garden.

words.meaning: water falling from clouds in drops
words.example: We took shelter from the rain.

words.meaning: a colourful arc in the sky caused by light refraction in raindrops
words.example: A rainbow appeared after the storm.

words.meaning: a large natural stream of water flowing to the sea
words.example: The river provides water for the fields.

words.meaning: a naturally occurring hard mineral material
words.example: They climbed over large rocks.

words.meaning: a period of the year with particular weather patterns
words.example: Autumn is the season for leaves to fall.

words.meaning: a farm animal kept for wool and meat
words.example: The sheep grazed quietly in the pasture.

words.meaning: the space above the Earth seen from the ground
words.example: The sky was clear and blue today.

words.meaning: frozen water that falls as flakes
words.example: Snow covered the mountains overnight.

words.meaning: the top layer of earth in which plants grow
words.example: Trees need good soil to grow.

words.meaning: the season between winter and summer when plants grow
words.example: Flowers bloom in spring.

words.meaning: a luminous point in the night sky; also a famous person
words.example: We counted stars on the clear night.

words.meaning: a small piece of rock
words.example: He skipped a stone across the lake.

words.meaning: a violent weather event with wind and precipitation
words.example: The storm knocked down trees.

words.meaning: the warmest season of the year
words.example: We go swimming every summer.

words.meaning: the star at the centre of our solar system that gives light and heat
words.example: The sun rose early this morning.

words.meaning: light from the sun
words.example: Sunlight warmed the room.

words.meaning: a large wild cat with stripes
words.example: The tiger prowled in the reserve.

words.meaning: a tall plant with a trunk and branches
words.example: A large tree shaded the picnic area.

words.meaning: a low area between hills or mountains
words.example: The village sits in a green valley.

words.meaning: an opening in Earth's crust that can erupt lava
words.example: The volcano last erupted many years ago.

words.meaning: the state of the atmosphere at a place and time
words.example: Check the weather before you travel.

words.meaning: a very large marine mammal
words.example: They went on a trip to see whales.

words.meaning: air moving from high to low pressure
words.example: The wind blew strongly across the plain.

words.meaning: the coldest season of the year
words.example: Winter brings snow to the mountains.
